titlestmt.titleproper: Red Bird, Oklahoma glass plate negatives
Red Bird, Oklahoma glass plate negatives

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

did.unittitle: Red Bird, Oklahoma glass plate negatives
did.abstract: Red Bird is located in Wagoner County, Oklahoma. The town was settled before 1900 by the Barber and Ruffin families. Collection consists of a group of 12 original glass plate negatives, depicting early views of homes, businesses and townspeople in the all black town of Red Bird, Oklahoma.

daodesc.p: Selected digitized images from this collection.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. Advance notice required for access. Contact the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk for paging information.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Red Bird, Oklahoma Glass Plate Negatives (Collection 1838). Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: Red Bird is located in Wagoner County, Oklahoma. The town was settled before 1900.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Group of twelve 5 inch by 7 inch glass plate negatives, depicting early views of homes, businesses and townspeople in the all black town of Red Bird, OK. Images include a grain elevator, a grocery store and a railroad station.

did.physdesc: 5 in x 7 in glass plate negative

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: A man in overalls and two women standing on the porch of a farmhouse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: A grain elevator, utility pole, several small buildings, a barn and scattered pipes.

did.unittitle: Grocery store in Red Bird, Oklahoma

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Six African American men sitting outside of a grocery store. Signs in the windows advertise the sale of dry goods, notions, groceries, and cigars.

dao.ns2:title: Grocery store in Red Bird, Oklahoma. Six African American men sitting outside of a grocery store. Signs in the windows advertise the sale of dry goods, notions, groceries, and cigars. (LSC.1838)

did.unittitle: House and stores in Red Bird, Oklahoma

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Double exposure showing men and women of Red Bird standing in front of a house with a carriage. The fainter exposure shows a store with a sign advertising tobacco.

scopecontent.p: Automobile with man in driver's seat and four children in the back seat parked in front of a railroad station.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Six men pose in front of a store front while two other figures lean out of a window in an adjacent building. Signs on the storefronts advertise Arm & Hammer Soda; Kantrip overalls, jumpers, and pants; and smoking & chewing tobaccos.

dao.ns2:title: Stores in Red Bird, Oklahoma. Six men pose in front of a store front while two other figures lean out of a window in an adjacent building. Signs on the storefronts advertise Arm & Hammer Soda; Kantrip overalls, jumpers, and pants; and smoking & chewing tobaccos. (LSC.1838)

daodesc.p: Stores in Red Bird, Oklahoma. Six men pose in front of a store front while two other figures lean out of a window in an adjacent building. Signs on the storefronts advertise Arm & Hammer Soda; Kantrip overalls, jumpers, and pants; and smoking & chewing tobaccos. (LSC.1838), [circa 1906?]
